definition: surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]
fate/portent/luck or disasters as foretold in the stars (astrology)

sentences.english: The patient is out of danger now, but it was touch and go for a while.
sentences.chinese: 病人现在已经脱离危险，但曾有一段时间吉凶未卜。

sentences.english: Man's life is full of the various good or ill luck.
Neo: Then why can't I see what happens to her?
sentences.chinese: 即如此，为什么我看不到她的吉凶？

sentences.english: The fate of the bill hung in balance.
At the moment they are simply annoying and an unknown commodity.
sentences.chinese: 此刻的表相只是让人有点恼怒，吉凶未知。

sentences.english: Ancient Chinese people thought that dreams can imply auspicious and inauspicious things.
sentences.chinese: 古代的中国人认为梦能预示吉凶。

sentences.english: Superficially, the Book of Changes is indeed about divination.
sentences.chinese: 从表面上看《周易》的确是一部占卜吉凶的书。

sentences.english: Our security and our position in the world are at stake.
sentences.chinese: 我们的安全以及在世界上的地位也会吉凶难卜。

sentences.english: The future, good or ill, was not forgotten, but ceased to have any power over the present.
sentences.chinese: 前途无论吉凶，尽管没有遗忘，但没有笼罩现在。

sentences.english: This decision puts our lives at stake .
sentences.chinese: 这么一决定，我们的生命就吉凶难卜了。

sentences.english: At stake are more than 20,000 jobs in Britain's aerospace industry.
sentences.chinese: 吉凶难卜的是英国航天工业的二万多个职位。

definition: fate/portent/luck or disasters as foretold in the stars (astrology)
divination based on the eight characters of one's birth date
the character 8 or 八/birthdate characters used in fortune-telling
six close relatives, namely: father 父[fu4], mother 母[mu3], older brothers 兄[xiong1], younger brothers 弟[di4], wife 妻[qi1], male children 子[zi3]/one's kin
to divine using the trigrams/fortune telling
to predict by divining/to look into the future
fateful accident/inauspicious matter (involving death or casualties)
the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1] and twelve earthly branches 十二枝/sexagenary cycle
